name: Glazed Red Pepper Jelly Drunken Salmon
description: What a sweet and sassy dish! Shines as a dinner for 4-6, or cut into 16 savoury bites for a tapas buffet.
preparation: In a small bowl, combine all marinade ingredients, and spread over salmon. Marinate 10 minutes.
Place salmon in a heat-proof serving dish.
Cover and bake 15–20 minutes, depending on the thickness of the salmon, basting once or twice.
Cut each fillet into bite-size pieces and arrange on a platter.
tips: Serve with extra wedges of lime or lemon and extra Red Pepper Jelly on the side.
Save time on clean-up; make, bake, and serve in Epicure Baker.
